messages.message: They use Google suite. So all their data is in GCP. I have requested them to migrate to AWS if possible. However, that would be be their last resort and we may face some push back

@Xi Cheng Installing the package on ib.com (http://ib.com) would be purely for testing purposes. In Colpal's env, on top of installing the package, we should be storing the creds as a kuburnetes secret which can then be accessed via env variables. We have already done this for a hashicorp vault password in one of our previous projects. The same has to be replicated for GCP authentication as well
@shaunak the planned go live is in April. I assume 23.04 will be deployed at the client end only after some kind of testing which may push the go live may be into June.
OK, I think we should still push on ColPal to get their data in S3.  This *should not be an option* at all from our side.

If they mainly just wanted to dump some results from UDF to some storage, I think we could suggest them to use S3 (which is supported by the ibfile handle if mounted in IB file system)? If they really wanted to have the data in their own GCS bucket, we could migrate those offline right? Introducing a GCS client library like this is quite disruptive, not to mention storing creds at the k8s level for this purpose
The other Colpal team uses S3 buckets, so this team should be ok to go that route @Venkatesh
